intro: Pityphyllum saragurense, commonly known as the Saragura buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many species of buttercups and other related plants. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
